title: The Charts of Cintas Suggest a Cautious Approach Ahead of Earnings
text:
During Friday's Mad Money program some time was used by Jim Cramer to highlight some of the upcoming earning's reports this week. On Tuesday, we'll hear from uniform supplier Cintas Corp. ( CTAS ) . Cramer recommended Cintas. Let's check to see if there is enough starch in the charts.

In this daily bar chart of CTAS, below, we can see a strong rally from the low in late December. Prices stayed above the rising 50-day simple moving average line into September. Prices broke below the 50-day line this month and have recently rallied back to the underside of this math-based indicator. Prices are still well above the rising 200-day moving average line.

The daily On-Balance-Volume (OBV) line shows a confirming rise from December and recently made a new high for the move up.

The trend-following Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) oscillator is poised to cross to the upside for a cover shorts buy signal.

In this weekly bar chart of CTAS, below, we can see that prices have come a long way in the past three years. CTAS is above the rising 40-week moving average line.

The weekly OBV line is bullish but the MACD oscillator has crossed to the downside for a take profits sell signal.

In this Point and Figure chart of CTAS, below, we can see a potential downside price target of $221.

Bottom line strategy: Was the price weakness in September a "shot across the bow" message that the earnings numbers could disappoint? I don't know but with a Point and Figure price target at the intersection of the 200-day moving average line, a cautious approach might be needed in the near-term.
description: Was the price weakness in September a 'shot across the bow' message?...CTAS

Was The Price Weakness In September A 'Shot Across The Bow' Message
